I agree in medical industry which includes pharmaceutical there is a problem The problem is getting upfront price for any good or service Try asking cost for any surgery from multiple place Almost all of them will avoid giving you a cost and just ask what insurance you have and that they do or do not accept that insurance If you have insurance they often try to tell you not to worry about the insurance will cover it even if it won t cover all of it I personally think advert are not the problem nor do I think it should be required to place price in advert To me the solution is insurance to go back to what it used to be in case of emergency and not for every day care That every day care should be a different sort of payment whether you want to pay every time you visit or get a deal like around here I see dentist advertise something like this and a FastMed or membership that give you free visit and discount for extra visit you may need for a set fee Now I know many of you think this is crazy but all insurance doe is hide the price and give doctor office and other medical group an excuse not to give you price upfront which make it impossible to shop around I work with an elderly man a my bos who get all sort of medical bill MONTHS after whatever he went in for The bill seldom ha a clear reference of what it is for or even when the event took place so he is always unsure whether it s been paid for already or if he should question it The total are always large with another large number for insurance then finally what the remainder is He also end up getting refund check sent to him for small amount since billing is such a mess that often time they sent the same bill twice so he paid twice Really medical need to be like other form of business get price upfront or clear estimate of what to expect aka range based on possible complication or need Another thing not uncommon in America is two get multiple bill for the same visit because one part usually the anesthetist is billed separately adding more confusion Final note Many doctor get affliation with drug company for deal that make the doctor encourage the use of that drug for benefit Also people in American culture prefer to pop a pill to solve a problem because it is easy and get to be not there problem I think if most pill were sugar pill we still have most people feeling better because they just felt the need for something outside to fix their life

column1: Business Outside The Lines - w/Chuck Peavey
column2: I m betting this is the first step of many to create transparency in the medical industry The problem is people in general got used to insurance company paying for something Since we didn t know what they actually cost we didn t worry Then under Obamacare it became mandatory The hospital and drug company raised their price the insurance company came after the government to subsidize the insurance more Ultimately the price for everything went up people just didn t know In 1997 I paid cash for hernia surgery All inclusive it wa around 2K In 2010 same surgery other side same doctor cash price 11K With insurance negotiated a price 4K How doe an insurance company get a 7 000 brake on the price Well the hospital setting the cash price that high ensures I need insurance and can t afford to pay cash The Insurance company paying that much more than the previous surgery mean the hospital make money The only people hurt Consumers and taxpayer

Im a medical doctor in korea Pricing of drug is a difficult matter because it nothing like other consumer product This is because the buyer and the consumer are different Whereas you could buy a car and also use it the doctor buy prescibes the drug for the patient who then consumes it That said the economics are different in different country In the state I believe the pharma can pay insurance company which in turn join hand with hospital and the benificiaries of the lobbying becomes the whole medical industry In Korea we have univeral coverage by the government and because the primary buyer of drug are the insurance provider the government they have dominant control over the pricing of drug Gov can say thats too expensive bring the price down or we re not going to cover it or even worse not allow it in the market This doe happen and sometimes lead to drug or medical product not being available That said I think the trump admin s move to clarify cost in pharma ad is 100 the right move The propsed uncertainty of differing insurance coverage can be clarifies by adding Consult your insurance agent for the coverage and out of pocket expense in getting name of drug at your clinic

Hey guy I work in a pharmacy a a tech and I have personally seen what high price can do to a person or family I ’ ve come across something really great that can help with your cost if you need it if you ’ re without insurance or if they don ’ t cover enough GoodRx is an app that I have on my phone that i use to help patient who don ’ t have insurance All you do is search for the drug strength and quantity and it search for be lowest priced pharmacy in your area So many of my regular patient have benefited from this and relief they feel when they see that don ’ t have to pay hundred for something they need it ’ s amazing Consider it if you need help ❤️

Here ’ s another HUGE factor that people fail to understand Even if your insurance cover a medication eventually someone ha to pay for it At the end of every year insurance company evaluate how much they paid out in claim and predict how much they will have to pay out over the next year This is how your insurance rate are calculated So when everyone want to be on the latest and greatest med or see specialist or have expensive procedure etc that all ultimately raise the price of your insurance But from an immediate standpoint an individual just see it a “ great My insurance cover it and my copay is only xxx Not considering what the original price wa and how eventually everyone on that insurance plan end up having to pay for it This is how small company insurance rate go through the roof when someone is diagnosed with an expensive disease like cancer or an autoimmune disease which ha some of the highest priced drug out there Sure insurance company may have negotiated lower price but on a say 1000 medication how much do you think they can really negotiate that down to And that ’ s once a month for 12 month That REALLY add up when more and more people go to ask their doc for the latest and greatest med There ’ s a reason why you see ad for what you see those are the money maker Drugs that have huge price Go look up the cost of Humara and Lyrica which I ’ m constantly seeing add for A lot of these could be solved if we had a single payer system and the government utilized it bargaining power It would also be better if drug company weren ’ t allowed to advertise Great book on this subject is “ Overdosed America ”

I learned that Social Anxiety Disorder wa a thing from a TV commercial for Paxil It changed my life immensely for the better Prior to it I had no idea such a disorder even existed and thought the problem it caused me were impossible to change So while I understand that people don t see pharma commercial a something that s a good idea I always shrink from proposal that they should be banned like they are in many country I know in my case my life would be much worse without them WRT price transparency this is VERY dangerous Consider this scenario You have health insurance which pay your family medical expense Your child break their arm There are 2 doctor in your town One doctor will put the child arm in a cast for 50 The other doctor will put the child arm in a cast for 500 You pay nothing regardless of which doctor you go to Which doctor are you going to take your child to The cheap one No This creates what I call reverse capitalism The more you charge the more reputable your medical service appears to be and the more business you will get The existence of medical insurance creates this So when people see they could take a 5 pill solution for their back pain or take the 150 pill solution and their insurance is footing the bill in either case they ARE going to go for the more expensive one People do not want to bargain hunt for their own well being And certainly not on behalf of the faceless insurance company that they re going to have to fight tooth and nail with for month in either case

I think this is still not addressing the main issue insurance company I ve worked a a pharmacy technician since 2013 and the main thing I ve noticed is whenever the pricing is high the insurance is the main cause Here s an example Let s say you have a prescription that s 200 cash price The insurance covered the full script so no cost to you at the pharmacy When I go for reimbursement from the insurance they tell me that my reimbursement of 100 will be in the next check they send u This mean insurance company choose how much they will pay It set the entire attitude of the market thus falsely inflating pricing I want to buy cheap and sell higher to afford to stock the medication and make a profit Manufacturers sell for higher because they need to turn a profit too sometimes too greedy like EpiPen In the end since the insurance chooses how much to pay if at all chargebacks are something where they change their mind after covering it initially the market is forced to jack price up to make their own profit It s a despicable system that I wish wa addressed since the only thing it doe is screw people over that don t have insurance or have the best insurance tier Sadly it doesn t just stop there the same thing is going on in hospital with the Charge Master but I m gon na stop here

As others have brought up part of our high drug cost is our lack of an ability to negotiate price a a whole country I d rather see them tackle that bullet point first It s down to each insurance company to negotiate and there are thousand of plan out there It s crazy convoluted However there s also the PBMs Pharmacy Benefit Managers They re the middle men who are supposed to help health insurance company manage their drug policy a well a negotiate what kind of profit pharmacy will make off each drug So big pharmacy like Walgreens Walmart and CVS can negotiate more profit while small home town pharmacy can t I actually had to stop filling two of my script at my independent pharmacy because my insurance wasn t even going to pay them the cost of the drug let alone a profit Walmart No problem filling them If you need to pay full price for a drug Walgreens is one of the most expensive place to fill PBM contract have a lot to do with that Those cost get passed up the chain too to the drug manufacturer There s also some shady kick back program to the PBMs And that doesn t even include the kickback their rep get for selling a practice on a certain drug It s a ridiculously tangled process and it s difficult to follow the paper trail Putting up the drug price may help people understand just what these med cost and look at what their insurance company is paying It s a step a small step which may help get more accountability and transparency from PBMs since the pharmaceutical company will want to point finger elsewhere I m cynical about it though It sound helpful at least a step But a a previous pharmaceutical CEO the HHS secretary know that this is the smallest step they can take that will still look like they re doing something without doing much in the long run I did see an article last year in the NY Times about how Trump want to tackle drug cost and PBMs So maybe

If you need a drug your doctor will prescribe it That argument by drug company is ridiculous and demonstrates what s wrong with the whole system Your doctor should be the one that determines treatment and explains the process and option to you Not drug ad and not drug company paying off that doctor to prescribe expensive and potentially le effective product when better or cheaper option exist Advertising drug make drug more expensive because ad are extremely expensive So bite the bullet and ban advertisement If Americans truly want cheaper prescription the first step is outright banning ad The next step is socialised healthcare The reason medical treatment is cheap in the UK is because there s a board that decides which medical treatment equipment drug get the monopoly That mean medical company have to substantially reduce cost to be in the running If they lose their bid hardly any of their product will ever be used in that whole of the UK It still ha a chance a an alternative for people who have allergy or reaction to the chosen product but that s still an overall loss And it s not that the cheapest option always win If another product is more efficient even if it cost more it ll win the bid but again they have to have substantially reduced cost to even be considered That s an intense competition That s serious capitalism at work for all the socialized healthcare hater It s an all or nothing competition and it work in people s favour That s why the exact same treatment in the UK cost significantly le There s no difference in the treatment there s just no money wasted by company having to pay off hospital and doctor to be the product of choice or spend billion on advertising Of course the product they then sell to people are going to cost a lot more they have a lot of money to cover just getting that product into the game and they re a business they still have to make a profit

As a physician working in a country with universal healthcare and high cost protection I obviously think this is better than nothing However in the long run I think the best way to protect patient from high price would be a high cost protection for prescription drug I e Patients only pay full price for their drug until a certain threshold After that they pay a progressively cheaper price until they ve reached the maximum spending threshold the maximum amount you have to spend on drug in a year after which they get their drug for free until a year ha passed since the first purchase Then the cycle start again The system is of course financed through tax It is quite good for keeping the price down aswell because if I prescribe a brand name drug to a patient the pharmacy will switch it to the cheapest non brand eqivalent This obviously motivates the company to keep their price down If I for some reason don t want the drug switched I can note that on the prescription and the patient will get the more expensive one still within high cost protection If my medical opinion is that it doesn t matter whether the drug is switched or not but the patient want the brand name drug anyway they can get that one but they have to pay for the price difference themselves As for drug ad I think it is weird to advertise for prescription drug It is not like any other consumer product that you go shopping for at leisure I am all for transparency but I don t think that ad are the best provider of that Obviously I would personally never withhold vital information from my patient or purposefully decieve them in any way and of course I think they should be able to do their own research Here we have a sort of national registry of all drug on the market It is available online for free and there is information written in leymans term a well a in med speech I feel like site like that are better for transparency than an ad from a pharmaceutical company

Like stated in the video the issue is too complex to provide price figure in a television commercial Every individual insurance plan is extremely unique and ha a varied formulary and tier system associated with it As a current pharmacy school student with over five year in the work environment I have seen the astronomical wholesale price of drug at it worst and insurance company s refusal to cover the cost of them on the contrary I have seen insurance plan approve astronomical amount although it often take some problem solving by the pharmacist to achieve this A good pharmacist will work to provide the best care for the patient and this includes finding an affordable treatment option often time the insurance company will not provide enough information to a consumer to choose the cheapest treatment option and it turn into a trial and error process between the prescriber and pharmacy adding yet another level of complexity to the issue is the use of drug manufacture coupon I feel a if a small portion of the population is aware of the potential manufacture rebate that can be obtained to make their medication affordable They often think and are told by their pharmacy that if insurance ha paid on the medication that is the bottom dollar price this is often not true Although there are a lot of financial avenue to negate the price they almost never work with federally or state funded insurance plan this leaf the patient that are usually in the most need for the expensive brand name drug covered by Medicare or Medicaid ineligible for this price break overall my recommendation would be to find a pharmacy and a pharmacist near you that is going to fight on your behalf and work with you to get you the care that you need I have a strong opinion that this level of care is more prevalent in an independent pharmacy over a chain pharmacy I avoid making that blanket statement that every pharmacist at a chain pharmacy won ’ t go out of their way to help the patient but often time in the independent pharmacy the pharmacist behind the counter ha a vested interest in building a personal relationship with each patient The common misconception that drug are cheaper at large chain pharmacy is flat out untrue aside from the Wal Mart 4 List that is heavily advertised Although this sound like an amazing price most independent drug store will work with you to achieve the same price point on those drug TLDR Find a pharmacist that will go to bat for you and this becomes a non issue Try an independent pharmacy if you are unhappy with your experience at a chain pharmacy

Hmm Alright Let ’ s get into this I ’ m a type one diabetic I have to get insulin all the time No matter what i do I need insulin With that said I have attempted to find out the COST of producing the insulin I take two type A long and a short acting Both made by different insulin pharma company IPC I ’ ve contacted them both and asked what price they sell the insulin to the insurance company IC here in the USA They can not answer that question because different IC get it at different price So I asked about my IC pricing They referred me to my IC When prodded further about their COST to produce said insulin they said they can ’ t give me answer about that because “ it varies ” How I don ’ t know and they wouldn ’ t explain further than “ it ’ s the material needed to produce the insulin that can fluctuate ” I don ’ t think that ’ s the case but I ’ m not the one making insulin so I don ’ t know I think one of the main issue is insurance company They need to pay a certain amount of the cost of the rx So in turn the distributor hike up the price to get more out of the IC because they will only get a small percentage from the consumer When I get insulin it cost me almost 200 a month Insurance is currently around 202 a week I go see the doctor every 6 month and have a 50 copay plus what ever blood work I need to get done which is typically about 100 150 Blood strip measuring the glucose level is the generic type by my pharmacy 15 a month I miss work sometimes to be able to control my glucose level Although I ’ m very lucky and can work from home if need be and I also take very good care of myself We need to redo the healthcare system Make it so you pay the doctor Not the IC Use IC a supplemental insurance Not the one you rely on The doctor will then compete Having worked in a pharmacy for a few year one thing that should be taken into consideration is sometimes it ’ s the insurance company that is the bad guy in regard to pricing There can actually be time when your insurance company charge you more for medication then the cash price would be for it It is not often but it doe happen An easy way for drug company to get around this rule would be saying “ ask your doctor how you can receive this medication for a little a 10 per month “ Then they give the doctor some coupon card to help push the medication and the next thing you know the patient is soon paying 100 a month when the coupon expires Personally I wish there wa a rule in regard to new and expensive medication to advertise that it may require additional paperwork from the doctor for the insurance company to pay for it not to mention time to order it One of the most irritating thing wa frequently having to deal with a brand new and expensive medication sent over by a doctor most likely getting paid to give it out only to have to fill out prior authorization for the insurance company that the doctor would take more than a week to do and then having to special order the medication And after all of that with the patient calling more and more irate every day ending up with a 50 co pay that they didn ’ t want to pay in the first place The whole system is incredibly flawed

Hey Walgreens pharmacy technician here drug are WAAAY overpriced I sell maybe 50 or more prescription a day and I have the ability to not only look up the price before insurance of a drug but also the generic equivalent price and how much we paid for it a a store and thus our markup I think one of the worst drug that s incredibly expensive is drug like viagra or other equivalent Typically they can be up to 50 per pill for the brand And although upping the pill amount on a prescription can lower the price per pill down to maybe 40 that s still for some men 400 a month which is 10 pill or if they wanted a full 30 day supply it d be 1200 Insurance also hardly cover any of that maybe covering 10 of the patient is lucky The generic equivalent isnt much better maybe costing 35 a pill instead of 40 50 Most of the problem actually come from pharma company charging outrageous price for their product Although pharmacy to mark up price to make profit on most drug the markup isnt entirely outrageous although dont get me wrong some of them ARE outrageous But typically the markup is 10 25 at most meaning that those high price are mostly due to pharma company charging sometimes hundred of dollar per pill some AIDS related medication can cost insane amount of money I hope that price come down for the sake of patient I sell prescription to every day I think the worst thing for me is to tell an older patient that their prescription is 100 more than it wa last month simply because their med D coverage is in the donut hole or the coverage gap meaning at that stage in their insurance the insurance company jack up price every month until they meet some sort of magic number in which afterwards most medication will be free or near free Well this is until the year start again in which case they have to go through it all over This wouldn t be so much of an issue if instead of their life saving prescription costing 600 per month they only cost 100 or even le And when you ve got an older patient with 5 or 6 prescription and their in the donut hole they could easily be spending upwards of 1000 per month on prescription even AFTER insurance We need more pharmaceutical company that produce more competition and aren t in cahoot with each other and the insurance company

As a doctor I see this a a people being stupid problem For drug to be FDA approved they must show equal or better efficacy than standard medicine already available Which mean when a patient go to their doctor and they are already on medication for that problem there is no medical reason to not give them that prescription I like the car analogy because it come down to what the patient want to spend their money on Most state have a requirement that all prescription be able to be downgraded to a generic equivalent For instance if you take your Lipitor prescription to the pharmacy you will be given the generic atorvastatin unless you ask for lipitor For this reason drug company almost universally drop the regular brand drug a soon a it go generic but they have trick for this where they combine that drug with another drug that is typically given to the same patient or they change the formula for the pill to make it release slower or something that make it significantly different than the original in order to make a new patent and they hope the brand name recognition will get patient to ask for the new one

I work for a Mail Order Pharmacy that is also a Prescription Benefits Manager so this is something that I can shed some light on While this could be a good thing that the drug company would be forced to show the list rice of their med it WOULd and DOES lead to immense confusion for the consumer When it come to drug cost there are actually three price of the medication You have the Current List Price which is how much the manufacturer charge pharmacy for that quantity of the drug then you have Approved Cost which is what your Insurance plan ha basically negotiated the total Cost down to for you and the last is the Copay Coinsurance also known a Patient Pay So let s say that for your Xarelto which ha no generic currently in the US the cost for 30 pill which you would take one pill per day is 1000 But you have great Rx insurance so the approved cost is only 750 and you went for the Gold standard plan so your copay is 50 Now imagine you see a commercial for the drug and that 1k price tag Most people would panic or avoid the drug because they don t factor the rest Now imagine you are over 65 and have no choice but to take the med or die There are way to keep drug cost down for our most vulnerable this is not one of them

Here s my two sense on the matter It s a long read I am NOT a medical professional but have experience with prescription drug for mental illness While making drug more accessible could be considered a good thing I think we should be pushing other alternative For example I suffer from BPD and major depressive disorder which we ve found is drug resistant Because of this I m seeking TMS a type of brain stimulation therapy with the hope that either I ll learn to react to medication or not need it at all The only thing in my way is that it ha a fucking insane price tag Luckily my family s insurance cover it but only after I ve not only seen a therapist for a certain amount of time but if I have record of seeing 3 or more drug fail to work within my time of treatment and diagnosis All of that being said I am currently on a 225mg dose of Effexor which is over the therapeutic recommended dose This wa because my psychiatrist insisted my depression would react to the boost Low and behold it didn t and now I m just taking a pill for it s side effect which are weight gain lethargy and a handful of other goody If TMS wa made more accessible I could have seen some result way sooner than before I had to boost my medication I could go on and on about this TMS thing and about it s own side effect which are very few but that is not the point of this comment As a bit of a topical side track we are seeing an extreme crisis around opioids While there are some case that find a painkiller of that caliber necessary I honestly think we should be pushing more physical therapy type treatment to have a lower price tag if at all possible I have seen withdrawal effect first hand a I experience them every time I miss even a single day of my medication They are painful and usually last a couple day or week after the drug is reintroduced TLDR I just wish we d push other alternative treatment and avoid prescribing drug

more general awareness of what you re getting but it could create a gray area of over accessibility This could result in a lot more people being prescribed substance that have a threat of developing a dependency being subject to a misdiagnosis or an overdose of yet another easily accessible substance due to people seeing what they re getting and going through the process to get it in any way they legally can Another bump in the road is to factor in thing like AARP Medical Coverage or even the concept of having medical insurance to begin with These institution do the research on price point and even offer discount based upon their unique tier system Some would argue that this method offer a safer alternative to accessing medicine that could prolong or save your life but at the cost of a higher premium for using their service It could hypothetically render most of those job opportunity obsolete and give that responsibility to the general public who is generally uninformed of most option that they have at their disposal In short there s an unintended yet foreseeable consequence to either standpoint My opinion create a regulated system of obtaining and researching different medication through either an organized effort like a website that can only be accessed through ID number given to you from your chart at the doctor s office or create an equally regulated system of cycling name brand medicine that have only recently been developed with other brand that have garnered consistent result into an accessible OTC form The newer one are only accessible through prescription at a medical facility and the reliable older one are cycled to the public at an accessible price point that is not only visible but comparable to promote healthy yet regulated competition

Maybe unpopular opinion but hear me out I think it ’ s important to remember that the blueprint at 1 44 said create incentive to lower list drug price While I agree that some medication are exorbitantly priced it ’ s also true that pharmaceutical company will only continue to innovate and research if they can recover their money and fund future product Marketing is a powerful tool and if too many new drug fail to get off the ground because of their perceived high initial cost we could be in big trouble Getting any drug through the drug testing process cost hundred of million if not billion per drug And that doe not include all the investment made on formula that failed out of the testing process part way through If a patient see an ad for an expensive new drug they may be deterred and not listen to their doctor when they say the old cheaper drug is le effective ha le side effect etc opting to continue with an older cheaper drug This situation could easily turn into consumer sticking with tried and true drug ignoring new product and bankrupting company that spent billion on drug research Why would pharma company risk making new drug when they can just market their old drug that have made back their investment and increase profit margin I ’ m not saying consumer should not be informed how much a drug is going to cost them but it is a bit naive to think a patient who see a commercial for an old drug being sold for 50 a month will switch to a new more effective drug that cost 200 a month just because their doctor recommend them too Maybe if the government subsidizes some of the research cost or fund more research itself drug company can comfortably lower price during their patent period All I ’ m trying to say is there need to be more that is done this can ’ t be the only way we try to pressure pharma company because we may not like how they decide to push back at u

As a medical assistant who work with primarily medicaid and medicare patient I know that often the name brand prescription aren t covered until patient fail trial of two or more similar medication and generic version of the same medication Commercial insurance is another game entirely and varies plan by plan so it can be a nightmare trying to figure out what is covered and how to get thing covered through prior authorization I think this is a step in the right direction because I ve had patient who say they want name brand medication only and refuse generic but then get mad at the doctor for prescribing a 1000 medication Companies and the government usually put out annually updated formulary for covered med but those aren t always accurate and aren t always easy to access The only way to know how much a prescription will cost out of pocket for a patient is for the pharmacy to run it through the insurance on file and patient don t like being slammed with a high price at the checkout counter Companies like GoodRx have started some competition with cash pay price but I can t wait for the day pharmaceutical company finally lower price appropriately and truly take the average patient into consideration

I sell prescription drug policy to Medicare recipient for my day job This is huge news One of the biggest thing that affect people I speak with daily is called the donut hole Once someone s medication cost certain amount for the year they pay more for their prescription until they re out of pocket cost total around 5 000 That is not unique to my company that is written right into the legislation of Medicare regulated drug plan for any company Legislation ha been reducing the donut hole year over year but people don t realize that those cost then get past back to recipient The cost of policy are going up next year and no one is happy about it my heart break that we have a system where some people are only getting 1 000 a month for their fixed income but have to pay almost half of that just to cover their prescription

This policy would lower drug price and will lower the cost of healthcare If they ’ re required to show price of their competitor they ’ re going to have to make their price look more appealing than their competitor At the same time if you show me a price that I see is too expensive I ’ m not going to buy that particular drug regardless of whether or not I suffer from the condition The erroneous part is that pharmaceutical are saying that I ’ m not going to buy a drug to deal with my condition I definitely will I had the condition and I ’ m going to want to treat it What ’ s going to happen is generic more affordable alternative will be purchased more which will force bigger company with higher price to figure out how to compete and so on and so forth The idea behind capitalism is that there ’ s a free market economy that would regulate pricing because of competition Right now Only the company that are already doing well can afford to advertise so essentially their competition is drastically reduced The other thing that need to be addressed a well is requiring doctor to disclose when they ’ re being paid or sponsored by a pharmaceutical company the same way that youtubers have to disclose it If my doctor is telling me about an alternative to the drug I heard about on tv he should have to tell me if the alternative he ’ s giving me is paying him to do it
